classificationDefs.name: CloudProvider
classificationDefs.description: The cloud provider is the organization that provides and runs the infrastructure for a cloud service. Typically the host it offers is actually a HostCluster. The cloud provider may offer infrastructure as a service (IaaS), in which case, an organization can deploy VirtualContainers onto the cloud provider's HostCluster.

classificationDefs.name: CloudPlatform
classificationDefs.description: If the cloud provider is offering platform as a service (PaaS), an application may deploy server capability onto the cloud platform.

classificationDefs.name: CloudService
classificationDefs.description: If the cloud provider is offering Software as a Service (SaaS) then it has provided APIs backed by pre-deployed server capability that an organization can call as a cloud service.
